intro: Echinocereus santaritensis, commonly known as the Santa Rita hedgehog cactus, is a species native to the Sonoran Desert in Mexico. It is a small, spine-tipped cactus with a globular or cylindrical shape, typically growing up to 30 centimeters in height. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, which attract pollinators such as bees and moths. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun exposure, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its unique structure and flowering patterns make it a notable species within the Cactaceae family.
